009package imagingbook.common.mser.components;
010
011import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
012import java.io.PrintStream;
013import java.util.ArrayList;
014import java.util.Arrays;
015import java.util.Collection;
016import java.util.Collections;
017import java.util.Comparator;
018import java.util.HashSet;
019import java.util.LinkedList;
020import java.util.List;
021import java.util.Set;
022
023import imagingbook.common.mser.components.PixelMap.Pixel;
024
025/**
026 * This class represents a connected component (i.e., a binary image region).
027 * Instances of this class form the nodes of a {@link ComponentTree}.
028 *
029 * @param <T> the type of properties that can be attached to instances of this class
030 */
031public class Component<T> { // implements Comparable<Component<?>>
032        
033        static int NEXT_ID = 0; // IDs are only used for debugging
034        
035        /** The ID number of this component (only used for debugging). */
036        public final int ID;    // unique component ID, for debugging only      
037        
038        // ------------------------------------------------------------
039        
040        private final int level;                        // intensity level associated with this region
041        private final List<Pixel> points;       // local points in this component (does not include points in child components) 
042        private int size;                                       // the total size of this component (number of points, includes children) 
043        
044        private Component<T> parent;                    // reference to the parent component (null if this is the root)
045        private Component<T> shortcut;                  // reference to a component in the same tree but closer to the root
046        private final Set<Component<T>> children; // the components at the next lower level
047        private int height;                                             // the height of the sub-tree rooted at this component
048        
049        private T properties = null;                    // additional component properties to be attached
050
051        // ------------------------------------------------------------
052        
053        /**
054         * Constructor. 
055         * Assigns a unique component id.
056         * @param level the maximum pixel value in this component
057         */
058        public Component(int level) {
059                this(level, NEXT_ID++);
060        }
061        
062        /**
063         * Constructor.
064         * @param level the maximum pixel value in this component
065         * @param id a unique component id (assigned by the factory)
066         */
067        Component(int level, int id) {
068                this.ID = id;
069                this.level = level;
070                this.points = new LinkedList<>();
071                this.parent = null;
072                this.shortcut = null;
073                this.children = new HashSet<>();
074                this.size = 0;
075                this.height = 0;
076        }
077        
078        // --------------------------------------------------------
079        
080        /**
081         * Returns the parent component of this component ({@code null} if 
082         * this node is the tree's root).
083         * @return the parent component
084         */
085        public Component<T> getParent() {
086                return parent;
087        }
088
089        void setParent(Component<T> parent) {
090                this.parent = parent;
091                this.shortcut = parent;
092        }
093        
094        void addToSize(int sizeInc) {
095                size = size + sizeInc;
096        }
097        
098        /**
099         * Returns the size (number of pixels) of this component.
100         * @return the size of this component
101         */
102        public int getSize() {
103                return size;
104        }
105        
106        void addChild(Component<T> c) {
107                children.add(c);
108        }
109        
110        /**
111         * Returns the list of this component's child components.
112         * @return a (possibly empty) list of components, never {@code null}
113         */
114        public Collection<Component<T>> getChildren() {
115                if (children == null) {
116                        return Collections.emptyList();
117                }
118                else {
119                        return children;
120                }
121        }
122
123        /**
124         * Returns the level (max. gray value) of this component.
125         * @return the component's level
126         */
127        public int getLevel() {
128                return this.level;
129        }
130        
131        void addPoint(Pixel p) {
132                points.add(p);
133                size = size + 1;
134        }
135        
136        /**
137         * Returns the height of the sub-tree which this component is the root of.
138         * @return the height of the sub-tree rooted by this component
139         */
140        public int getHeight() {
141                return this.height;
142        }
143        
144        void setHeight(int newHeight) {
145                height = newHeight;
146        }
147        
148        /**
149         * Returns a list of "local" pixels that directly belong to this component
150         * All these pixels have the same 'level' as the component itself.
151         * @return the component's local pixels
152         */
153        public Collection<Pixel> getLocalPixels() {
154                return this.points;
155        }
156        
157        /**
158         * Returns a collection of all pixels of this component,
159         * including the component's local pixels
160         * and the pixels of all child components.
161         * Not needed in actual code, used only for debugging.
162         * @return all pixels contained in this component
163         */
164        public Collection<Pixel> getAllPixels() {
165                Collection<Pixel> compPoints = this.getChildPixels();
166                compPoints.addAll(this.points);
167                return compPoints;
168        }
169        
170//      public Collection<Pixel> getAllPixels() {
171//              Collection<Pixel> allPoints = new ArrayList<>(this.size);
172//              allPoints.addAll(this.points);
173//              allPoints.addAll(this.getChildPixels());
174//              return allPoints;
175//      }
176        
177        /**
178         * Returns a collection of all pixels contained in the
179         * children of this component.
180         * @return all pixels from child components
181         */
182        public Collection<Pixel> getChildPixels() {
183                Collection<Pixel> childPoints = new ArrayList<>(this.size);
184                for (Component<T> child : this.children) {
185                        childPoints.addAll(child.getAllPixels());
186                }
187                return childPoints;
188        }
189        
190        /**
191         * Sets the properties of this component.
192         * @param properties a property object (of type T)
193         */
194        public void setProperties(T properties) {
195                this.properties = properties;
196        }
197        
198        /**
199         * Returns the properties attached to this component.
200         * @return the properties attached to this component
201         */
202        public T getProperties() {
203                return properties;
204        }
205        // ------------------------------------------------------------------
206        
207        /**
208         * Recursively locates the root of the tree that contains this component,
209         * returning the first ancestor node that has no parent, which my be this
210         * node itself. 
211         * The {@link #shortcut} field is used to quickly move up to nodes closer to
212         * the root. The {@link #shortcut} field is updated "on the way back", i.e.,
213         * by the unwinding recursion.
214         * 
215         * @return the root of the sub-tree containing this component 
216         */
217        Component<T> findRoot() {
218                if (this.isRoot()) {
219                        return this;
220                }
221                else {
222                        shortcut = shortcut.findRoot(); // unwinding recursion updates shortcut 
223                        return shortcut;
224                }
225        }
226        
227        /**
228         * Returns {@code true} if this component is the root of the associated {@link ComponentTree}.
229         * @return {@code true} if this component is the root
230         */
231        public boolean isRoot() {       // TODO: change/clean/check!
232                return parent == null; // || this.parent == this;
233        }
234        
235        /**
236         * Returns {@code true} if this component represents an extremal region.
237         * @return {@code true} if the component is extremal
238         */
239        public boolean isExtremal() {
240                return isRoot() || parent.level > this.level;
241        }
242        
243        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
244        
245//      @Override
246//      public int compareTo(Component<?> other) {
247//              return Integer.compare(this.level, other.level);
248//      }       
249        
250        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
251        
252        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
253        private String listChildIds() {
254                int[] ids = new int[this.children.size()];
255                int i = 0;
256                for (Component<T> child : children) {
257                        ids[i] = child.ID;
258                        i++;
259                }
260                return Arrays.toString(ids);
261        }
262        
263        
264        /**
265         * Sorts a list of Components by (decreasing) component size, i.e.,
266         * the largest component (with the most pixels) becomes the first.
267         * 
268         * @param components a list of {@link Component} instances
269         */
270        public static void sortBySize(List<? extends Component<?>> components) {
271                Comparator<Component<?>> cmp = new Comparator<Component<?>>() {
272                        @Override
273                        public int compare(Component<?> mser1, Component<?> mser2) {
274                                return Integer.compare(mser2.getSize(), mser1.getSize());
275                        }
276                };
277                Collections.sort(components, cmp);
278        }
279        
280        /**
281         * Sorts a list of Components by (increasing) component level, i.e.,
282         * the component with the lowest level becomes the first.
283         * 
284         * @param components a list of {@link Component} instances
285         */
286        public static void sortByLevel(List<? extends Component<?>> components) {
287                Comparator<Component<?>> cmp = new Comparator<Component<?>>() {
288                        @Override
289                        public int compare(Component<?> mser1, Component<?> mser2) {
290                                return Integer.compare(mser1.level, mser2.level);
291                        }
292                };
293                Collections.sort(components, cmp);
294        }
295        
296
297        // ---------------------------
298        
299//      public void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
300//              strm.format("Component %d(%d): size=%d locPts=%d chldPts=%d allPts=%d parent=%s shortcut=%s children=%s extrml=%b", 
301//                              this.ID, this.level, 
302//                              this.size,
303//                              this.points.size(),
304//                              this.getChildPoints().size(),
305//                              this.getAllPoints().size(),
306//                              (this.parent == null) ? "x" : (this.parent.ID + "(" + this.parent.level + ")"),
307//                              (this.shortcut == null) ? "x" : (this.shortcut.ID + "(" + this.shortcut.level + ")"),
308//                              //this.findRoot().ID,
309//                              this.listChildIds(),
310//                              this.isExtremal()
311//                              );
312//      }
313        
314        void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
315                strm.format("Component %d(%d): size=%d locPts=%d chldPts=%d allPts=%d parent=%s",
316                                this.ID, this.level, 
317                                this.size,
318                                this.points.size(),
319                                this.getChildPixels().size(),
320                                this.getAllPixels().size(),
321                                (this.parent == null) ? "x" : (this.parent.ID + "(" + this.parent.level + ")")
322                                );
323        }
324        
325        @Override
326        public String toString() {
327                ByteArrayOutputStream os = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
328                PrintStream ps = new PrintStream(os);
329                this.printToStream(ps);
330                return os.toString();
331        }
332        
333//      public String toStringShort() {
334//              return String.format("%d(%d)", ID, level);
335//      }

350}
